metadata.Title: CVE-2021-46848 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
GNU Libtasn1 before 4.19.0 has an ETYPE_OK off-by-one array size check that affects asn1_encode_simple_der.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtasn1-3-bin - 4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3+esm3
libtasn1-6 - 4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3+esm3
libtasn1-bin - 4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> out of bounds read in API when using invalid value, not likely to be exploitable in any way

criterions.comment: libtasn1-6 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3+esm3').
